subject: Delinking Avenue Plantations from EPC/HAM/BOT Toll Projects.
text: Hraly <5ty rTHNfgifetasrut (4sw5 4Rdev #r HART4, HRG TIFR) National Highways Authority of India (Ministry of Road Transport and Highways, Government of India) Tn TR vfl-5 Qa 6, Taz7-10, 81a5, 7ff Raorht 110 075 = G-5 & 6, Sector-10, Dwarka, New Delhi-110075 T/Phone 91-11-25074100 25074200 NHAI/Policy Guidelines/Environment/2023 Policy Circular No. 7.4.9 dated 15th March, 2023 (Decision taken on e-office file Comp. No. 46753) Sub:: Delinking Avenue Plantations from EPCIHAMBOT Toll Projects reg: The issue regarding delinking of Avenue Plantation from EPC/HAM/BOT Toll Projects was discussed in 550th EC Meeting held on 28.02.2023. Reference EC Agenda Item No_ 550.01 (B)(iii) (a) , the following decision has been taken regarding Median & Avenue Plantation: A_ For New Projects Plantation work to be done as under: Median Plantation To be done by contractor/concessionaire as it requires regular pruning and maintenance. ii Avenue Plantation (a) To be deleted from Scope of work in relevant Schedules of EPC/HAM/BOT(Toll) Agreements. Accordingly, proposed modifications in Schedules of EPC, HAM and BOT(Toll) projects are attached as Annex I, Il & III B. For Ongoing Projects Member Concerned to take decision on de-scoping of avenue plantation on case to case basis, considering the progress of plantation work at site. (a) The cost of the plantation shall be worked out by the concerned AE/IE based on the Forest Schedule of Rates of the respective State_ (b) If the aforesaid cost of plantation is not agreed by the contractor / concessionaire, the same may be resolved amicably by referring the matter to a Sole Conciliator. 2_ It has been decided to the Avenue Plantation work executed either through Government Agencies like Forest Department / Forest Development Corporations/ Urban bodies/ State Rural Livelihood Mission (SHGs)/ Nehru Yuva Kendra Sangathan etc: by entering MoUs OR through a Private Plantation Agency by inviting bids, Whichever is the most effective for successful plantation. The following circulars/OMs issued by NHAI may be referred for implementing the same: (i) NHAI Standard Operating Procedure (SOP) for implementation of Green Highways (Plantations, Transplantation, Beautification and Landscaping) Policy, 2015. (ii) NHAI OM No. NHAI/GHD/Plantation/2021/005 dated 30.03.2021 on the subject Approval of Request for Proposal (RFP) for Plantation Projects on large NH Stretches & Delegation to RO to invite bid of NH length maximum 100 km or Rs. 10 Cr. estimated cost for one plantation project  (iii) NHAI Policy Circular No. 7.4.7/2022 dated 12.07.2022 on the subject 'Specification for Avenue and Median Plantations f.Rpa kovxL Cont__2 rToTHRf M { T 9 NHAL get
